resources.string: The Academy welcomes you to join

The SH Academy is an international learn to swim program member of the United States Swim Schools Association (www.asaswimming.com) 
The SH Academy methods are based on up-to-date and common knowledge of sports/swimming science and teaching methods. The step by step program makes sure your child will be prepared, educated and trained under the aspects of ergonomic, growth acceleration and physiology to swim for health, safety, fun and fitness as well as it will set up the base for competitive aquatic sports.


Children must be at least 5 years old to start the SH Academy Step program. 
The classes on step 1 to 7 have a coaches/swimmers ratio of 1:8


Step Description: The SH Academy teaches children in a step by step process a foundation of water safety and proper swimming technique 
The child may have other swimming skills, but will not excel without the foundation of water adaptation, water experience and breathing foundation. 
 Each term to promote the children to the next step

We are an Academy based on international knowledge of swimming, years of experience from learn to swim up till high level competitive swimming and most of all passion for the sport. \nOur Mission is to introduce our members to the water and friendship close with water for lifetime. Wherever the path leads - competitive aquatics, fitness and health, recreational swimming or just enjoy - we guarantee to teach skills of safety, confidence and opportunity.

Parents of SH Aquatic members are expected to adhere to the following guidelines and supervision requirements. These guidelines are designed to promote and ensure a positive and safe experience for everyone:
All SH Aquatic members will be required to use the separate entrance to the Swimming Pool and head directly to the changing rooms.

It is important that parents ensure their children are ready to start their class at the scheduled time with their required training equipment. \nWhen swimmers arrive late, it causes a disruption to the class and swimmers miss the warm up, which is a very important part of the training session.
Swimsuit, Towel, Swimming Cap*, Goggles* are mandatory *will be available to buy directly at the pool
Parents often ask if they need to stay at the pool during class time - this depends on your child’s age

• A parent of swimmers aged less than 10 years are required to stay at the pool during their child is in a class. \n• Parents of swimmers aged 10 years and over do not need to stay to watch their child’s class - this is optional. \n• Parents of older swimmers (14 years+) are encouraged to occupy themselves during training rather than stay and watch their child train.

Parents who choose to watch their child’s class are asked to please sit in one of the areas where seating is provided. Please do not sit or stand on the pool deck as this should be kept clear for coaches and swimmers. \nParents should not attempt to communicate (verbally or non-verbally) with their child during a class - this causes distractions. \nParents should not talk or comment to the coach during class time. It is important that parents understand that coaches and students must not be interrupted whilst a class is being conducted.

Parents may, if necessary, briefly communicate with coaches after a class. 
Note: A reasonable amount of communication with your child's coach is approximately a few minutes each term 
It is important that parents understand that coaches and students must not be interrupted whilst a class is being conducted. 
Parents meetings will be organized in regular periods and any update will be announced and published. 
Parents may request an additional meeting with the coach, please contact us if you wish to arrange this.

The responsible coach will welcome and collect the swimmers at the “kiss and drop” point in time to start the session. \nDuring the class your child is under full responsibility and supervision of the coach. \nWe request you support us doing our work at its best by let the coach teach and coach your child.
After each session the coach will bring the group to the “kiss and drop” point and hand over responsibility and supervision to the parent.
SH Aquatics does not provide supervision in the locker/changing rooms and we assume no liability for your belongings.

In general if a swimmer misses their regular class, no make-up classes will be provided. 
If a swimmer will be unable to attend classes for a period of two or more weeks due to a significant injury or illness, an arrangement to switch the group will be provided. 

We would appreciate your notification or announcement of any planned absence ahead. Attendance reports are made by the coaches directly. 

SH Aquatics do not offer refunds for Academy classes and swimming training services. In exceptional and medical circumstances, in which a valid doctor's certificate must be provided, partly refunds may be granted. 
All refunds are awarded at the discretion of the managing director.

It is important that parents behave maturely and treat SH Aquatic members and staff respectfully. 
Aggressive or inappropriate behavior will not be tolerated. 

By signing the registration form and payments you agree and accept the general terms of conditions as well as the privacy policy.
• The booking fee is payable before your first lesson . Incoming payments secure your booking. \n• Your booking fee is redeemable for your registered term.
• SH Aquatics accepts bank transfer only, no cash payments. Please, provide your bank confirmation at the first lesson.

• Our fees are calculated on a term basis and you are required to pay for the full term. 
• Term payments must be made in full; prior to the first lesson. 
• If payment is not received before your first lesson we cannot guarantee your booking. If you are experiencing any difficult with payment, please, discuss with our administrative staff. 
• In case SH Aquatics needs to cancel lessons (due to maintenance or technical problems) make up lessons will be provided. 
• SH Aquatics do not offer refunds for Academy classes and swimming training services. In exceptional and medical circumstances, in which a valid doctor's certificate must be provided, partly refunds may be granted. All refunds are awarded at the discretion of the managing director.
•\tAre parents required to stay at the pool during classes?
